attributes.action: Sixth form freedom back- when we have a free we can leave.
attributes.additional_details: Sixth form should be a place where we learn more freedom and experience that more freedom, now I’ve heard multiple people say they will not be going sixth form over this.
attributes.background: Birkenhead high school academy has taken away our freedom in sixth form, for years when you had a free lesson you could leave school. if you only had one lesson all day and say if that was in the morning you could go home after that , now we are being made to stay in school and put in classrooms.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about when students can leave school premises are a matter for individual schools, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your concern directly with your school, or with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
